alert.note: Alert for Weld (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 16 at 3:26PM MDT until June 19 at 6:00PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory is extended for the following rivers in Colorado... Cache La Poudre River near Greeley affecting Weld County. ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL MONDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Cache La Poudre River near Greeley. * WHEN...Until Monday evening. * IMPACTS...At 7.5 feet, Sections of the Poudre River Trail begin to overtop from Windsor to Greeley. At 8.0 feet, The Cache La Poudre River floods 71st Avenue in northern Greeley. Lowland and trail flooding occurs along the Cache la Poudre River from Windsor through Greeley. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:50 PM MDT Friday the stage was 7.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to start to slowly rise overnight. the river will rise in response to additional rainfall through Saturday night. The river will fall below 7.0 feet late Sunday. - Action stage is 7.0 feet. - Flood stage is 8.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
